question_stem: 17. A 72-year-old Caucasian（白人） male experiences progressive shortness of breath,and is diagnosed with emphysema（肺气肿）. He had smoked up to one packper day of cigarettes until 5 years ago. Family history reveals that his father,two paternal uncles, and his father's mother all died of emphysema, anda diagnosis of α1-antitrypsin deficiency (AAT) is suspected.He is found to have decreased amounts and abnormal mobility（迁移度） of AAT protein in his serum when analyzed by serum protein electrophoresis（血清蛋白质电泳）. Liverbiopsy （肝活检）discloses mild scarring (cirrhosis。硬化) and demonstrates microscopicinclusions（显微镜下镜检发现有包含物） due to an engorged（膨胀的） endoplasmic reticulum（ER。内质网）. Which of the following is the most likely explanation for these findings? (3.0分)
choice: A.Defective transport from hepatic ER to the plasma B.A mutation affecting the N-terminal methionine（N-端的甲硫氨酸） and blocking initiation ofprotein synthesis C.A mutation affecting the signal sequence（信号序列） D.Defective structure of the signal recognition particles（信号识别颗粒） E.Defective energy metabolism causing deficiency of GTP
correct_answer: A.Defective transport from hepatic ER to the plasma
